Reason: The configuration option _journalAgeThreshold is performance-sensitive. This is because it directly impacts the performance of the system by determining the age threshold for the journal entries. Setting a lower threshold can lead to more frequent removal of older entries, potentially improving performance by keeping the journal size in check. Additionally, the code context indicates that this configuration is passed as a parameter when creating a PersistentJournal object, suggesting that it plays a crucial role in the system's functionality and performance.
